clinical_study.brief_title: Nebulized Beclomethasone Dipropionate Improves Respiratory Lung Function in Preschool Children With Recurrent Wheezing
clinical_study.official_title: Nebulized Beclomethasone Dipropionate Improves Respiratory Lung Function in Preschool Children With Recurrent Wheezing

lead_sponsor.agency: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

clinical_study.source: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-centre, open label study, aiming to evaluate the efficacy of beclomethasone dipropionate applied for 12 weeks with a dose of 400 µg twice a day (total dose 800 µg nebulized), on airway resistance and reactances (measured with Rint and FOT techniques) in children with recurrent wheezing, aged 2-5 years. In addition, clinic score as frequency of symptoms and exacerbations, will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Lung fuction with Rint and FOT

arm_group.description: Nebulized Beclomethasone dipropionate applied for 12 weeks with a dose of 400 µg twice a day (total dose 800 µg).

intervention.description: Nebulized beclomethasone dipropionate applied for 12 weeks with a dose of 400 µg twice a day (total dose 800 µg)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed and subscribed consent before any procedure
- Age range : 2 - ≤5 years
- Male and female patients
- Recurrent wheezing affected ( ≥ 4 episodes in the last 12 months)
- PAI positive (at least one primary and two secondary ):
Primary:
1. one parent with asthma
2. Atopic Dermatitis
3. sensibilisation to air allergen
Secondary:
1. Food sensibilization
2. wheezing also not during the infective episodes
3. eosinophilia (>4%)
Exclusion Criteria:
- story of severe wheeze requiring hospitalization
- treatment with inhaled glucocorticoids during the previous 4 weeks or with oral glucocorticoids in the previous 8 weeks
- structural abnormalities of the lungs (tracheobronchial bronchomalacia, external compressions, etc)
- Persistent infections
- aspiration lung disease (gastroesophageal reflux disease, etc.)
- Cystic fibrosis
- prematurity or bronchopulmonary dysplasia
- Tuberculosis
- primary ciliary dyskinesia
- congenital heart disease
- pulmonary foreign body
- bronchiectasis
- Immunodeficit
